meta.name: Get a daily cybersecurity news digest on Telegram and Slack with GPT-4

parameters.name: q
parameters.value: cybersecurity OR cyber attack OR data breach OR vulnerability

parameters.text:
=Articles:
{{ JSON.stringify($json.articles) }}

Errors:
{{ JSON.stringify($json.errors) }}

Tasks:
1. Select the 5 most important cybersecurity stories
2. Write a concise summary for each (2‚Äì3 lines)
3. Add a short headline per story
4. End with a one-line note if any data sources failed

options.systemMessage:
You are a professional cybersecurity news analyst.

You receive:
‚Ä¢ A list of normalized cybersecurity news articles
‚Ä¢ A list of API errors (if any)

Your job is to produce a clear, concise, factual daily cybersecurity news digest.

Rules:
- Focus on impact, severity, and relevance
- Prefer data breaches, ransomware, nation-state attacks, and critical vulnerabilities
- Ignore marketing fluff or low-impact news
- Do NOT hallucinate facts
- If some sources failed, mention it briefly at the end
- Maintain a professional tone

Must Must Must Rank stories by severity: Critical, High, Medium.

parameters.content:
##  News Sources
Fetching from multiple APIs with error handling

##  Data Processing
Deduplication, normalization & error handling

AI Analysis
GPT-4 powered threat intelligence analysis with categorization

## üì§ Multi-Channel Delivery
Telegram, Slack, Email + Archive to Google Sheets

# Advanced Cyber Threat Intelligence Digest System

**Created by: Abdullah Dilshad**
iamabdullahdishad@gmail.com

##  Key Features

###  **Multi-Source Aggregation**
- GNews API for mainstream news
- NewsAPI for comprehensive coverage
- Reddit r/cybersecurity for community insights
- Expandable to RSS feeds, CISA alerts, CVE databases

###  **Smart Deduplication**
- Levenshtein distance algorithm
- 80% similarity threshold
- Prevents duplicate stories from multiple sources

###  **AI-Powered Analysis**
- GPT-4 threat prioritization
- Automatic categorization (Breach, Vulnerability, Tool, Research)
- Severity rating (Critical, High, Medium)
- Actionable summaries for security teams

###  **Robust Error Handling**
- Retry logic with continueOnFail
- Admin alerts for failures
- Timeout protection (10s)
- Fallback mechanisms

###  **Multi-Channel Distribution**
- **Telegram**: Instant mobile notifications
- **Slack**: Team collaboration channels
- **Email**: Executive-friendly HTML format
- **Google Sheets**: Searchable historical archive

###  **Quality Assurance**
- Message length validation
- Character count monitoring
- Warning alerts for oversized digests
- Source count tracking

---

##  Perfect For

 **Security Operations Centers (SOCs)**
 **Cybersecurity Teams**
 **IT Security Managers**
 **Incident Response Teams**
 **CISOs & Security Leadership**
 **Security Researchers**
 **Penetration Testers**

 Time: ~20 minutes

**Requirements**:
- n8n instance (cloud or self-hosted)
- OpenAI API key
- GNews API key (free tier available)
- NewsAPI key (free tier available)
- Telegram Bot Token
- (Optional) Slack workspace access
- (Optional) Google Sheets for archiving
- (Optional) Email SMTP credentials

articles.title: Nike currently 'investigating a potential cybersecurity incident' as 1.4TB of data allegedly stolen

The hackers focus on data theft rather than encryption and traditional ransomware

articles.title: 149 Million Passwords Of Instagram, Netflix, X, Roblox Leaked Online: How To Know If You Are Affected
articles.content: In an alarming data leak, over 149 million unique logins and passwords, has been exposed online in a publicly accessible database. Discovered by cybersecurity researcher Jeremiah Fowler, the unsecured repository contained credentials harvested from i... [2996 chars]
articles.description: Over 149 million logins and passwords were found exposed in an unsecured online database, cybersecurity researcher Jeremiah Fowler revealed. Affected services include Gmail, Facebook, Instagram, Netflix and banking platforms. Though the data was removed, risks like fraud and identity theft remain. Users are advised to check breach status, change passwords and enable two-factor authentication.

articles.title: First Federal Savings Bank and ICBA Promote Cyber Awareness and Consumer Protection During Data Privacy Week Jan 25-31
articles.content: EVANSVILLE, Ind., Jan. 25, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- In recognition of Data Privacy Week, First Federal Savings Bank and the Independent Community Bankers of America¬Æ (ICBA) are reminding customers to take proactive steps to safeguard their personal a... [3592 chars]
articles.description: EVANSVILLE, Ind., Jan. 25, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- In recognition of Data Privacy Week, First Federal Savings Bank and the Independent Community Bankers of America¬Æ (ICBA) are reminding customers to take proactive steps to safeguard their personal and financial information amid an evolving cybersecurity landscape. The¬†average cost of a data breach in the United States rose to $10.22 million in 2025, signaling both continued attacks and increasing regulatory fines even as global costs declined 9% year over year.

realTimeArticles.message: Real-time news data is only available on paid plans. Free plan has a 12-hour delay. Upgrade your plan here to remove the delay: https://gnews.io/change-plan
